Detailed Description

A Fragment that dispalys a list od items.

A fragment that displays a list of items by binding to a data source such as an array or Cursor, and exposes event handlers when the user selects an item.

ListFragment hosts a ui::ListWidget object that can be bound to different data sources, typically either an array or a Cursor holding query results. Binding, screen layout, and row layout are discussed in the following sections. Optionally, your widget hierarchy can contain another widget object of any type to display when the list widget is empty. This "empty list" notifier must have an id "gaia:empty". Note that when an empty widget is present, the list widget will be hidden when there is no data to display.

You bind the ListFragment's ListWidget object to data using a class that implements the ui::IListItemProvider interface.

You must use setListProvider(IListItemProvider) to associate the list with an adapter. Do not directly call ui::ListWidget#setProvider(IListItemProvider) or else important initialization will be skipped.

See also:
setListProvider
Widget::ListWidget

void gaia::core::ListFragment::setListShown ( bool  show)

The default content for a ListFragment has a TextWidget that can be shown when the list is empty.

If you would like to have it shown, call this method to supply the text it should use.

void gaia::core::ListFragment::setListShownNoAnimation ( bool  shown)

Like setListShown(bool), but no animation is used when transitioning from the previous state.
